intro: Streblosa johannis-winkleri, commonly known as the Winkler's streblosa, is a rare and specialized plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in late spring. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in humid tropical forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
